Generation III.Ruby: Barboach 's sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This Pok é mon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.
Generation III.Sapphire: Barboach 's body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pok é mon just slips out of the enemy's grip. This Pok é mon grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.
Generation III.Emerald: Its body is covered with a slimy film. The film acts as a barrier to prevent germs in muddy water from entering the Barboach 's body.
Generation III.FireRed: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.

Generation IV.Diamond: It coats its entire body with a slimy fluid so it can squirm and slip away if grabbed.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Barboach uses its whiskers to taste things just as a person uses his or her tongue to taste things.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Barboach uses its whiskers to taste things just as a person uses his or her tongue to taste things.

Generation VI.Y: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Barboach's sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This Pokémon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Barboach's body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pokémon just slips out of the enemy's grip. This Pokémon grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.

Generation VII.Sun: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.
Generation VII.Moon: Its slippery body is hard to grasp, so much so that there are festivals where people compete to see how many they can catch barehanded.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its entire body is gooey. When pecked at by bird Pokémon, it slips and slides its way to freedom.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its whiskers are filled with nerves. They can sense smells and flavors just as a person's nose or tongue would.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
Generation VIII.Shield: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It coats its entire body with a slimy fluid so it can squirm and slip away if grabbed.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey’s location.
Generation IX.Violet: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
